longDescription: Polynucleotides (PN) are DNA fragments that supercharge your skin’s repair response. We micro-inject PN along cheeks, temples, and jawline to hydrate deeply, reduce redness, and tighten texture. Think of it as a skin reboot that pairs beautifully with fillers, lasers, or PRP—ideal for anyone craving lit-from-within radiance without downtime.

seo.metaTitle: Polynucleotide Treatment London | DNA Skin Therapy | Dr. SNA Clinic
seo.metaDescription: Regenerate facial skin with polynucleotide injections. Doctor-led treatment improves hydration, elasticity, and glow in just 2 sessions.

schema.howPerformed: After cleansing and numbing your skin, ultra-fine needles deliver micro-droplets of purified polynucleotide (DNA fragments) across your face using bio-aesthetic points. These DNA building blocks penetrate the dermal layer, where they signal your fibroblasts to ramp up collagen and elastin production. They also attract water molecules for deep hydration and calm inflammatory pathways that cause redness. The process takes about 30 minutes. You'll see tiny bumps that smooth within hours
schema.preparation: Come with clean, makeup-free skin. Stay super hydrated for 3 days before (drink 2-3 liters daily). Stop blood-thinning supplements for one week. Avoid alcohol and processed foods 48 hours before—PN works best in a clean system. If you have sensitive or rosacea-prone skin, this is your ideal treatment. Come ready for regeneration
schema.followup: Tiny injection bumps disappear within 12-24 hours. Don't massage or press treated areas for 24 hours. Avoid makeup, intense exercise, saunas, and direct sun for 24 hours. Drink lots of water to support cellular repair. Your second session 3 weeks later completes the course. Skin continues improving for 4-6 weeks as collagen rebuilds
schema.outcome: Skin looks plumper, more hydrated, and luminous—the lit-from-within glow. Fine lines soften. Texture becomes smoother and more refined. Redness calms dramatically. Pores appear smaller. Your complexion reflects light beautifully. Makeup sits flawlessly. Unlike fillers, PN doesn't add volume—just pure skin quality improvement. Results last 6-9 months
schema.treatmentFrequency: Two sessions spaced 3 weeks apart for initial course, then maintenance sessions every 6-9 months to preserve that regenerated glow
schema.adverseOutcome: Small injection bumps for 12-24 hours (normal and expected). Possible pinpoint bruising. Mild swelling in delicate areas. Very rarely, tiny lumps that dissolve within days
contraindication: Active skin infection, rash, or rosacea flare
Severe allergies to DNA-derived products (extremely rare)
Autoimmune skin conditions without specialist clearance
typicalTest: Skin hydration analysis using specialized scanner
Discussion of skincare routine and concerns
Medical history including any inflammatory skin conditions
clinicalFindings: Fine lines and loss of elasticity
Post-procedure skin recovery (after lasers or peels)
Desire for natural skin quality improvement
Prevention of aging for younger patients

description: Highly purified polynucleotide injections regenerate collagen, calm inflammation, and restore bounce across the face and neck.
title: Polynucleotide Face Therapy

overview.title: What PN Does for the Face
overview.content: PN attracts water, signals fibroblasts, and moderates inflammation pathways. We place it across cheeks, temples, jawline, and neck to smooth fine lines, repair barrier damage, and enhance luminosity. It’s the ideal maintenance treatment between fillers or as a standalone glow plan.
highlights: Pairs with PRP, lasers, or skin boosters

hero.headline: Regenerate. Rehydrate. Radiate.
hero.subheadline: Polynucleotide injections reboot collagen and skin health from the inside out.

faq.answer: No—PN hydrates and repairs skin at a cellular level but doesn't create volume or structure like filler. Many patients combine both: filler for volume, PN for skin quality.
faq.question: Is polynucleotide the same as filler?
How often do I need polynucleotide treatment?
faq.answer: Most clients repeat every 6-9 months for maintenance. The initial course is 2 sessions spaced 3 weeks apart. Some patients book before events for an extra glow boost.

faq.question: How much does polynucleotide treatment cost?
faq.answer: A single session is £400. The PN Duo Glow (2 sessions + LED) is £750 (save £50). The PN + PRP Fusion is £1,150 (save £180). Consultation fee (£50) is credited toward treatment.

faq.question: Does polynucleotide hurt?
faq.answer: We apply topical numbing cream before treatment. Most patients describe mild pinpricks rather than pain. The injections are superficial and use ultra-fine needles.

faq.question: When will I see results from polynucleotide?
faq.answer: Initial glow appears within 10 days as hydration improves. Full results develop over 4-6 weeks as collagen rebuilds and skin texture refines. Results continue improving between sessions.

faq.question: Is polynucleotide safe for sensitive skin?
faq.answer: Yes, PN is excellent for sensitive and rosacea-prone skin. It calms inflammatory pathways and reduces redness. DNA fragments are biocompatible and well-tolerated by all skin types.

faq.question: Can I combine polynucleotide with other treatments?
faq.answer: Absolutely. PN pairs beautifully with skin boosters, PRP, lasers, and fillers. Many patients use PN as prep before other treatments or as recovery support after. Dr Abbas will design your optimal combination.

faq.question: How long do polynucleotide results last?
faq.answer: Results typically last 6-9 months. Longevity improves with good skincare, hydration, and sun protection. Regular maintenance sessions help sustain that lit-from-within glow.
